Orthography: Conventions used in Blust (Meyer, F. (1937) Sikanees-Nederlands woordenboek. Manuscript.)
Conventions used in source. What is "é"?
IPA. Phonetic/Phonemic correspondence: [ʊ] = interconsonantal /u/; [ɪ] is the pronunciation of i between two consonants; [ɐ] is the pronunciation of a between 2 consonants.

IPA.  ̘ = advanced tongue root. Samely & Barnes (2013:14-), systematically refer to the advanced tongue root vowels as breathy vocied vowels. Samely (1991:37) refers to them simply as advanced tongue root vowels.
IPA. But the stress markings appear to be in odd places.
